page.title: 08Fordlands Farm-NE. Tiverton
page.content: On the farm I mainly help with the cows and renew old gate posts with new ones. I help move the the bullocks from field to field. I very often dig ditches to help the water run away so the gateways don't collect too much mud and stop the tractors from going in and out. When it is time to cut hay and straw I help cut and store it. In the winter I help bed up the cows.On the farm they have a bull. It is only young so it is quite dangerous. Sometimes I spread dung to fertilise the fields. On Sunday afternoons we often walk through what is called the Rifle Range.During the war the Americans used to practice shooting big shells.There's a field at the top of the farm which has big holes (dips) which those shells made.
